page.title: 16RAISING MONEY, BENGEO SCHOOL
page.content: Last term, our class and teacher, Mrs. Clarke, were thinking about{Ethiopia where many people die each day because they don't get enough food and water. We discussed several ways of raising money for them, before we came up with the idea of using the school's 3{micro {computers}and bringing in others from home so we could charge for games. As the day drew near, we hit on some {problems.}Some micros were unreliable and kept refusing to work. Also a few games were too difficult to learn. On the day 10 computers were wheeled in displaying{- PSST! GHOULS! JETPAC!- {ONLY 5p.}Ours decided not to load. As we worked frantically, the first of 8 classes were waiting....Eventually the hall became a racket of crashes,tunes, beeps and bangs almost drowning the incessant noise from the children.
